Transcendence.quote: That which is beyond thought and word, yet gives rise to both. (Kena Upanishad 1.3)

Unity.quote: All differences dissolve in the One. (Plotinus, Enneads V.8)

Infinity.quote: To see a world in a grain of sand, and heaven in a wild flower. (William Blake, Auguries of Innocence)

Immanence.quote: Closer is He than breathing, and nearer than hands and feet. (Tennyson, The Higher Pantheism)

Omniscience.quote: He knows what lies before them and what lies behind them. (Quran 2:255)

Omnipresence.quote: Where can I go from your Spirit? Where can I flee from your presence? (Psalm 139:7)

Omnipotence.quote: With God all things are possible. (Matthew 19:26)

Creation.quote: In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth. (Genesis 1:1)

Providence.quote: Even the very hairs of your head are all numbered. (Luke 12:7)

Justice.quote: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne. (Psalm 89:14)

Grace.quote: By grace you have been saved through faith. (Ephesians 2:8)

Love.quote: God is love, and whoever abides in love abides in God. (1 John 4:16)

Wisdom.quote: The Lord by wisdom founded the earth. (Proverbs 3:19)

Truth.quote: I am the way, the truth, and the life. (John 14:6)

Beauty.quote: One thing I have desired of the Lord: to behold the beauty of the Lord. (Psalm 27:4)

Consciousness.quote: That which knows all thoughts, yet is itself unknown. (Kena Upanishad 1.6)

Non-Being.quote: The Tao is empty, yet inexhaustible. (Tao Te Ching 4)

Silence.quote: Be still, and know that I am God. (Psalm 46:10)

Light.quote: God is light, and in Him there is no darkness at all. (1 John 1:5)

Word.quote: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God. (John 1:1)

Life.quote: In Him was life, and that life was the light of all mankind. (John 1:4)
